alert.note: Alert for Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 2:57PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cochise County through 345 PM MST... At 256 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles west of Cloverdale, or 20 miles northeast of Douglas, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly remote areas of southeastern Cochise County. This includes Route 80 between mile markers 390 and 396. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox
